Either WARNING, CODE.REVIEW or ERROR

The setting for this field determines whether all failures to meet the required standards for the same STANDARDS.CHECK are displayed or only the first such occurrence is displayed plus a counter for each additional occurrence.
YES - All standards messages for the same STANDARDS.CHECK are displayed
NO - Only the first standards message is displayed plus a counter for any additional occurrences of STANDARDS.CHECK
The file tag to be used when generating HTML output.
Any character A to Z, a to z, 0 to 9, space and !"#$%&'()*+,-./:;<=>?@[\]^

A list of T24 programs for which certain coding standards are expected. The checks are defined in the EB.COMPILE routine and will produce a warning message if the checks are not passed. The message is defined in STANDARDS.MSG. Program compilation will be allowed. The checks are performed whenever one of these programs is called in the program being compiled.
The checks are only for variable prefixes. File variables must be prefixed with F. and record variables must be prefixed with R.
A predefined list of T24 programs.
The setting for this field determines whether all code review items are displayed or only the first such occurrence is displayed plus a counter for each additional occurrence.
YES - All code review messages for the same SEARCH.TEXT are displayed
NO - Only the first code review message is displayed plus a counter for any additional occurrences of SEARCH.TEXT.
Associated with SEARCH.TEXT, if specified then if the program being checked is in this list no warning or error message will be produced if the specified text is found.

The text to be searched for before compiling the program. If present in the code then the associated fields DEPENDENT.TEXT, IGNORE.PROG, IGN.NO.ICOMMON and PREV.CHAR.LIST will be checked and if all criteria are met then either a warning or an error message will be produced based on the field MSG.TYPE associated to this SEARCH.TEXT.
1)Define SEARCH.TEXT field as 'FBNK... to imply text scanning starting with ‘FBNK followed by
any character, but preceding with either null or space (before ‘FBNK).
2) Similarly ...FBNK could be defined to imply text scanning ending with FBNK,but end of string
should be either null or space.
3)Define SEARCH.TEXT field as ...FBNK... to imply text scanning of the string FBNK in any part
of the program/ subroutine
